c74object.name: bach.stream
c74object.description: Makes an llll containing the last N received elements.

objarg.name: index
objarg.description: The optional argument sets the starting index, i.e. the number of elements to be streamed at once.

method.name: llll
method.description: Any incoming llll is iterated on its root level, and its elements are fed to the streaming system. The algorithm will output from the first outlet the N last received elements, provided that at least N elements have already been received (or in any case if the partial attribute is set to 1).

attribute.name: index
attribute.description: Sets the number of elements to be streamed at once (i.e. the length of the output lllls). Defaults to 1.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

attribute.name: partial
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to also output lllls having less than the number of elements set by the index attribute, i.e. toggles the ability to also output lllls when still incomplete. Defaults to 0 (off).
